job_tasks.phrase: build and maintain ETL pipelines
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the traditional software engineering task of creating and managing data pipelines, which are essential for moving and transforming data.

job_tasks.phrase: create foundational data models in our data warehouse
job_tasks.justification: Building data models within a data warehouse is a core software engineering task focused on structuring data for analysis and reporting.

job_tasks.phrase: integrate new data sources using DataOps best practices, including documentation and testing
job_tasks.justification: Integrating new data sources and adhering to DataOps practices (documentation, testing) are standard software development and operational tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: support other data specialists in their work to make their queries and tables efficient and their use of data effective
job_tasks.justification: This involves optimizing existing data structures and queries, which falls under software engineering best practices for performance and usability.

job_tasks.phrase: build and maintain data models, libraries and the tooling supporting data processing
job_tasks.justification: This reiterates the core software engineering responsibility of building and maintaining data infrastructure and tools.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with team members to collect business requirements, define successful outcomes, and design data models
job_tasks.justification: Collecting requirements and designing data models are fundamental software engineering activities that bridge business needs and technical implementation.

job_tasks.phrase: Leverage raw data in our data warehouse to build a curated data models
job_tasks.justification: Transforming raw data into curated models is a standard data engineering/software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Write production quality ELT code (Python, SQL) with an eye towards performance and maintainability
job_tasks.justification: Writing production-quality code in specific languages with a focus on performance and maintainability is a direct software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Create and maintain architecture and systems documentation
job_tasks.justification: Documentation is a crucial part of the software development lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: Maintain our data catalog as a scalable resource to support self-service and serve as single source of truth for data definition
job_tasks.justification: Managing a data catalog involves software system maintenance and ensuring data integrity, aligning with software engineering principles.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide data modeling expertise to all team members through code reviews, pair programming, and training to help deliver optimal, DRY, and scalable database designs and queries
job_tasks.justification: Code reviews, pair programming, and training on data modeling and query optimization are core software engineering practices for knowledge sharing and quality assurance.

job_tasks.phrase: Improve, manage, and teach code maintainability and performance standards in code submitted and reviewed
job_tasks.justification: Teaching and enforcing coding standards for maintainability and performance is a key software engineering responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Help our team maintain and improve the infrastructure for data collection, processing, management and analysis
job_tasks.justification: Maintaining and improving data infrastructure is a core data engineering/software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Research, design, implement and drive new solutions and software for solving complex data processing problems across all of DeepL
job_tasks.justification: This encompasses the full software development lifecycle from research and design to implementation and deployment for data processing challenges.

job_tasks.phrase: Work on our internal tools to make the data easily accessible to our internal stakeholders
job_tasks.justification: Developing and maintaining internal tools to facilitate data access is a software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: collect business requirements
job_tasks.justification: Understanding and gathering business needs is crucial for aligning technical work with business objectives.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with team members
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions collaboration with colleagues.

job_tasks.phrase: support other data specialists in their work
job_tasks.justification: Providing support to colleagues indicates a collaborative effort.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide data modeling expertise to all team members through code reviews, pair programming, and training
job_tasks.justification: Sharing expertise through code reviews, pair programming, and training is a form of collaboration and knowledge transfer.

job_tasks.phrase: teach code maintainability and performance standards
job_tasks.justification: Teaching standards to team members is a collaborative and knowledge-sharing activity.

job_tasks.phrase: Open communication, regular feedback
job_tasks.justification: This directly refers to communication and feedback, key elements of collaboration.

job_tasks.phrase: smooth collaboration
job_tasks.justification: Explicit mention of collaboration.

job_tasks.phrase: direct and actionable feedback
job_tasks.justification: Feedback is a component of communication and collaboration.

job_tasks.phrase: leading with empathy makes us better together
job_tasks.justification: Empathy and working 'better together' are strong indicators of a collaborative environment.

job_tasks.phrase: Become a domain expert in the data you are work with
job_tasks.justification: The goal of becoming a domain expert implies continuous learning and deep understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: Research, design, implement and drive new solutions
job_tasks.justification: Researching and driving new solutions indicates a proactive approach to learning and innovation.

job_tasks.phrase: Annual learning budget
job_tasks.justification: The provision of a learning budget explicitly supports professional development and learning.

job_tasks.phrase: solve complex technical challenges
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the need for problem-solving skills in a technical context.

job_tasks.phrase: solving complex data processing problems
job_tasks.justification: Focuses on the ability to solve complex problems related to data processing.

job_tasks.phrase: Research, design, implement and drive new solutions
job_tasks.justification: Driving new solutions implies initiative and ownership.

job_tasks.phrase: Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.
job_tasks.justification: Hack Fridays and valuing initiatives, impact, and creativity point towards innovation and ownership.

job_tasks.phrase: If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. At DeepL, it's all about the value you bring and the growth we can foster together. Go ahead, apply-let's discover your potential together.
job_tasks.justification: Encouraging application even without checking all boxes and focusing on value and growth fosters an environment of initiative and ownership.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on tasks related to building, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines, data models, and internal tools. There is no mention of developing, fine-tuning, or integrating Generative AI models or traditional ML models. The core responsibilities fall under Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering), specifically 1.A.1. Software Development & Integration, with mentions of DataOps and traditional data tools. No tasks from Macro-Category B (GenAI Specialization) are present. Therefore, the profile is 'Software Engineer'.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and detailed about the responsibilities, which are consistently focused on data engineering and software development tasks. There is no ambiguity regarding the absence of AI/ML model development or integration, making the classification straightforward.
